article:
A 'psychic reading' is a specific attempt to discern information through the use
of heightened perceptive abilities; or natural extensions of the basic human
senses of sight, sound, touch, taste and instinct. These natural extensions are
clairvoyance (vision), clairsentinece (feeling), Claircognisance (factual
knowing) and Clairaudience (hearing) www.thepsychicinstitute.com.au
and the resulting statements made during such an attempt. [http://parapsych.org/glossary_l_r.html#r Reading] - Key Words
Frequently Used in Parapsychology, Parapsychological Association (2010-04-
14) The term is commonly associated with paranormal-based consultation
given for a fee in such settings as over the phone, in a home, or at psychic
fairs. Diane Daniel
[http://cache.boston.com/globe/calendar/features/psychics/ What's in the cards
Just how well do the seers see?] The Boston Globe (Calendar cover story cache
1999) Carmen Nobel
[http://www.boston.com/lifestyle/articles/2008/04/10/vision_quest/?page=full
Vision Quest] The Boston Globe, April 10, 2008 Though psychic readings are
controversial and a focus of skeptical inquiry, a popular
interest in them persists. Wendy Haskett [http://articles.latimes.com/1987-08-15/news/vw-44_1_psychic-
fair Psychic Fairs Aim for Aura of Fun in Mind Reading] LATimes.com, August 15,
1987 Extensive experimentation to replicate psychic results in laboratory
conditions have failed to find any precognitive phenomena in humans. Stuart J. Ritchie, Richard Wiseman, Christopher C. French. Failing
the Future: Three Unsuccessful Attempts to Replicate Bem's âRetroactive
Facilitation of Recallâ Effect. PLoS ONE, 2012;
[http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0033423]
plosone.org Psychic reading has been described as a
pseudoscience. A cold reading technique allows psychics to produce
seemingly specific information about an individual from social cues and broad
statements.
